member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.AlpacaController
member.summary: A Custom REST MVC controller with additions to help handle Alpaca responses and error responses. This contains the Alpaca endpoints that are common to all devices.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.AlpacaController.Action(System.UInt32,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Invokes the specified device-specific action.

remarks.para: Actions and SupportedActions are a standardised means for drivers to extend functionality beyond the built-in capabilities of the ASCOM device interfaces.

The key advantage of using Actions is that drivers can expose any device specific functionality required. The downside is that, in order to use these unique features, every application author would need to create bespoke code to present or exploit them.
The Action parameter and return strings are deceptively simple, but can support transmission of arbitrarily complex data structures, for example through JSON encoding.
This capability will be of primary value to
* bespoke software and hardware configurations where a single entity controls both the consuming application software and the hardware / driver environment

* a group of application and device authors to quickly formulate and try out new interface capabilities without requiring an immediate change to the ASCOM device interface, which will take a lot longer than just agreeing a name, input parameters and a standard response for an Action command.
The list of Action commands supported by a driver can be discovered through the SupportedActions property.
This method should return an error message and NotImplementedException error number (0x400) if the driver just implements the standard ASCOM device methods and has no bespoke, unique, functionality.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)
A well known name that represents the action to be carried out.
List of required parameters or an Empty String if none are required
member.response: Transaction complete or exception

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Method or parameter value error, check error message

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Server internal error, check error message

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.AlpacaController.CommandBlind(System.UInt32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Transmits an arbitrary string to the device

remarks.para: Transmits an arbitrary string to the device and does not wait for a response. Optionally, protocol framing characters may be added to the string before transmission.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)
A well known name that represents the action to be carried out.
If set to true the string is transmitted 'as-is', if set to false then protocol framing characters may be added prior to transmission.
member.response: Transaction complete or exception

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Method or parameter value error, check error message

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Server internal error, check error message

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.AlpacaController.InterfaceVersion(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The ASCOM Device interface version number that this device supports.

remarks.para: This method returns the version of the ASCOM device interface contract to which this device complies. Only one interface version is current at a moment in time and all new devices should be built to the latest interface version. Applications can choose which device interface versions they support and it is in their interest to support previous versions as well as the current version to ensure they can use the largest number of devices.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.ProcessBaseController.BadRequestAlpacaProtocol(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.BadRequestObjectResult@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Validates the HTTP request for compliance with the Alpaca protocol and identifies bad requests.
member.remarks: This method checks for various conditions that violate the Alpaca protocol, such as incorrect URL capitalization, invalid form keys, or the presence of both form and query parameters in the same request. If a violation is detected, it logs the error and sets the parameter to describe the issue.
member.param: When the method returns , this parameter contains a describing the error. Otherwise, it is .
A reference to the client identifier. If an optional key validation fails, this value may be set to 0.
A reference to the client transaction identifier. If an optional key validation fails, this value may be set to 0.
member.returns: if the request is determined to be invalid according to the Alpaca protocol; otherwise, .

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.ProcessBaseController.DeviceCannotAcceptOperation
member.summary: Determines whether the device cannot accept the requested operation based on the current HTTP request path and device state.
member.remarks: This method evaluates the HTTP request path to extract device-related information, such as the device type, device number, and requested operation. It then checks if the specified device exists and whether it is in a state to accept the operation.
member.returns: if the device cannot accept the requested operation; otherwise, .

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.ProcessBaseController.ExecuteRequest``2(System.Func{``1},System.Func{``1,``0},System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.String)
member.summary: Executes a request by performing the specified operation, building a response, and handling exceptions.
member.remarks: This method logs the API call, validates the request if strict Alpaca mode is enabled, and executes the provided operation. If the operation succeeds, the response is built using the provided response builder and includes the client and server transaction IDs. If an exception occurs, the method returns an appropriate error response.
member.typeparam: The type of the response object, which must inherit from .
The type of the value returned by the operation.
member.param: A delegate that performs the operation and returns a value of type .
A delegate that builds a response of type using the value returned by .
The unique identifier for the server transaction.
A reference to the client identifier. This value may be modified during the request.
A reference to the client transaction identifier. This value may be modified during the request.
An optional string containing additional data associated with the request. Defaults to an empty string.
member.returns: An containing the response object of type if the operation succeeds, or an appropriate error response if an exception occurs.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.ProcessBaseController.ProcessRequest(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Processes a client request by executing the specified operation and returning a response.
member.remarks: This method is intended for internal use and is not exposed through the API, as indicated by the with IgnoreApi = true.
member.param: A delegate representing the operation to execute. The operation must return a or value indicating success or failure.
The unique identifier for the transaction. This value is used to track the request.
The unique identifier for the client making the request. This value is updated during the request processing.
The unique identifier for the client's transaction. This value is updated during the request processing.
An optional string containing additional data or parameters for the request. Defaults to an empty string if not provided.
member.returns: An containing a object that indicates the result of the operation. The property will be if the operation succeeded; otherwise, .

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.TelescopeController.SlewToTargetAsync(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Asynchronously slew to the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination coordinates.

remarks.para: Move the telescope to the TargetRightAscension and TargetDeclination equatorial coordinates, return immediatley after the slew starts. The client can poll the Slewing method to determine when the mount reaches the intended coordinates.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.TelescopeController.UTCDate(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the UTC date/time of the telescope's internal clock.

remarks.para: The UTC date/time of the telescope's internal clock in ISO 8601 format including fractional seconds. The general format (in Microsoft custom date format style) is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffZ E.g. 2016-03-04T17:45:31.1234567Z or 2016-11-14T07:03:08.1234567Z Please note the compulsory trailing Z indicating the 'Zulu', UTC time zone.

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)
member.response: Transaction complete or exception

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Method or parameter value error, check error message

response.examples: Error message describing why the command cannot be processed

member.response: Server internal error, check error message

member.param: Zero based device number as set on the server (A uint32 with a range of 0 to 4294967295)
